render.tex: \title{Domain of $f(x)$} \\ %text What is a domain and how to find it for a function $f(x)$ %

reason.tex:
%text The domain of a function $f(x)$ is the set of all values of $x$ for which $f(x)$ is defined. Below are a few example functions and their domains %
\begin{align} \begin{tabular}{NNN} \hline f(x) & \text{Not defined if} & \text{Domain} \\ \hline\hline \tfrac{1}{x} & x = 0 & \mathbb{R} - \left\lbrace 0\right\rbrace \\ \hline \tfrac{1}{\sqrt{x+2}} & x + 2 \leq 0\text{ or } x \leq -2 & (-2,\infty) \\ \hline \tfrac{1}{x^2-1} & (x-1)\cdot(x+1) = 0 & \mathbb{R} - \left\lbrace -1,1\right\rbrace \\ \hline \log x & x \leq 0 & \mathbb{R}^+ \\ \hline \end{tabular} \end{align}
